citation.article-title: Weissella soli sp. nov., a lactic acid bacterium isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Weissella soli sp. nov.
Weissella soli (so´li. L. n. solum soil ; L. gen. n. soli of the soil)
Cells are Gram-positive, non-motile, non-sporeforming, catalase-negative rods 0.9x1.2-3.0 μm in size, often thickened at one end and occurring singly or in pairs.
The cells in a pair are often of different size.
After anaerobic growth at 30 °C for 2 days, colonies on MRS agar are 1 mm in diameter; they are off-white, smooth and convex.
Growth on MRS agar occurs both in an aerobic and an anaerobic environment.
Obligately heterofermentative and produces mainly dlactic acid.
Growth occurs between 4 and 40 °C, but not at 42 °C.
Acid is produced from L-arabinose, ribose, D-xylose, D-glucose, D-mannose, salicine, maltose, melibiose, sucrose, trehalose, D-raffinose and D-arabitol.

Acid is not produced from glycerol, erythritol, D-arabinose, L-xylose, adonitol, methyl β-D-xyloside, galactose, D-fructose, L-sorbose, rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, mannitol, sorbitol, methyl α-D-mannoside, methyl α-D-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, lactose, inulin, melezitose, amidon, glycogen, xylitol, β-gentiobiose, D-turanose, D-lyxose, D-tagatose, D-fucose, L-fucose, L-arabitol, gluconate, 2-keto-gluconate or 5-keto-gluconate.
Aesculin is hydrolysed and arginine is cleaved.
No dextran is produced from sucrose.
The G+­C content of the DNA is 43 mol%.
